chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik Amir Nichols Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established. 
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment as recommended by Agent.
Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.
Defendant to read the hand out given in court on drug abuse and verify to Agent that he has read it.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence forthwith.

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik Amir Nichols Berry in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Malik Amir Nichols Berry. State file Amended Information; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; recomm. reviewed; Def. pleads Guilty to Resist - Failure to Stop in Count 1 and Misd. BJ in Count 2; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Resist-Failure to Stop in Count 1 and Misd. BJ in Count 2 w/Counts 3, 4 & 5 D&RI; State heard; Atty. George-Stifler heard; Def. makes a statement, has been in custody 100 days; Court imposes sentence

Count 1: Resist-Failure to Stop
Count 2: Misd. BJ
**W/H - 1 year PO
- $263 CC each count
- $200 DNA surcharge/sample each count
- Count 1: 10 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. forthwith
- AODA & FT
- any counseling/treatment as deemed approp.
- Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court. 
- Told to read the hand out on drug abuse and verify to Agent that he has read it

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Jin Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik Amir Nichols Berry in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Malik Amir Nichols Berry. Preliminary waiver filed. Court reviews & accepts waiver, binds over to Br 3.
Arraignment scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
8:39 AM ADA Pack appears for State. Defendant appears in custody. Court notes SPD appointed Atty George yesterday.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik Amir Nichols Berry appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein appeared by video for Malik Amir Nichols Berry (not determined yet); Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests cash bond; Atty. Strohschein response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 4/28/22 at 8:30am in Br. 2 & Review 4/27/22 at 8:15am in Br. 1; Court sets $5,000 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
